word_mean: ［拉］ 〔复larvae〕幼虫(昆虫)，蚴(蠕虫)：在某些动物生活史中，处于一个独立的、能动的、有时需喂养的发育阶段。参见imago和pupa

sentence.Network_en: A larva metamorphose into a chrysalis and then into a butterfly.
sentence.Network_cn: 幼虫变为蛹,然後再变成蝴蝶.

sentence.Network_en: The larva hatches out and lives in the soil.
sentence.Network_cn: 幼虫孵化之后就在土壤里生活.

sentence.Network_en: A caterpillar is the larva of a butterfly.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (denoting a disembodied spirit or ghost): from Latin, literally ghost, mask'

entry.def: A larva is an insect at the stage of its life after it has developed from an egg and before it changes into its adult form.

example.ex: The eggs quickly hatch into larvae.

means.word_mean: 1. the immature free-living form of most invertebrates and amphibians and fish which at hatching from the egg is fundamentally unlike its parent and must metamorphose
